export var questionObj={"Qtext":"
 
Suppose that \(k \), \(l \), \(p \), and \(q \) are in proportion. Now prove that, 
\[	
	\frac{(k - l )^3}{(l - p )^3} = \frac{k }{q } \text{ and, }
\]
\[
	\sqrt{kl } + \sqrt{lp } - \sqrt{pq } = \sqrt{(k + l - p )(l + p - q )}
\]
\newline

","Steps":[{"id":"s1","n_params":2,"step_txt":"$$\text{
 
It is given that $k $, $l $, $p $, and $q $ are in proportion.}$$
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{k }{l } = \frac{l }{p } = \frac{p }{q } = r \textrm{ (assume)}
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow p = \input[s1v1]{}\input[s1v2]{}
\]"},{"id":"s2","n_params":2,"step_txt":"
\[
	\Rightarrow l = rp = \input[s2v1]{} ^2 q 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow k = rl = r ^3 \input[s2v2]{}
\]"},{"id":"s3","n_params":2,"step_txt":"
Now, for the first equation, left hand side of the equation can be written as 
\[
	\textrm{LHS } = \frac{(k - l )^3}{(l - p )^3}
\]
\[
	= \frac{(\input[s3v1]{} ^3 q - r ^2 q )^3}{(r ^2 q - r\input[s3v2]{} )^3}
\]"},{"id":"s4","n_params":2,"step_txt":"
\[
	= \frac{(r ^2 q (\input[s4v1]{} - 1))^3}{(rq (r - 1))^3}
\]
\[
	= \input[s4v2]{} ^3
\]"},{"id":"s5","n_params":2,"step_txt":"
Right hand side of the equation can be written as
\[
	\frac{k }{q } = \frac{\input[s5v1]{} ^3 q }{q } = \input[s5v2]{} ^3 
\]"},{"id":"s6","n_params":2,"step_txt":"$$\text{
From the above two expressions, we can write that LHS $=$ RHS.

Now, for the second equation, on left hand side we have}$$
\[
	\textrm{LHS } = \sqrt{kl } + \sqrt{lp } - \sqrt{pq }
\]
\[
	= \sqrt{\input[s6v1]{} ^3 q r ^2 q } + \sqrt{\input[s6v2]{} ^2 q rq } - \sqrt{rq q }
\]"},{"id":"s7","n_params":2,"step_txt":"
\[
	= q \sqrt{ \input[s7v1]{} } (\input[s7v2]{} ^2 + r - 1)
\]"},{"id":"s8","n_params":2,"step_txt":"
Now, right hand side of the equation becomes
\[
	\textrm{RHS } = \sqrt{(k + l - p )(l + p - q )}
\]
\[
	= \sqrt{(\input[s8v1]{} ^3 q + r ^2 q - rq ) (\input[s8v2]{} ^2 q + rq - q )}
\]"},{"id":"s9","n_params":2,"step_txt":"
\[
	= \sqrt{rq (\input[s9v1]{}^2 + r - 1) q (r ^2 + r - 1)}
\]
\[
	= q \sqrt{\input[s9v2]{} } (r ^2 + r - 1)
\]"},{"id":"s10","n_params":0,"step_txt":"$$\text{
From the above two expressions, we can observe that LHS $=$ RHS.

Hence proved.
\newline
}$$
"}]};export var resp=[{"data":["r","q"],"text":"$$\text{After assumption $\frac{k }{l } = \frac{l }{p } = \frac{p }{q } = r$ and taking terms separately we get $p = rq$}$$ "},{"data":["r","q"],"text":"$$\text{Similarly, for $l$ and $k$ we get $l = rp = r ^2 q$ and $k = rl = r ^3 q$}$$"},{"data":["r","q"],"text":"$$\text{Substituting the value of $k$, $l$ and $p$ in the LHS, we get $\frac{(r ^3 q - r ^2 q )^3}{(r ^2 q - rq )^3}$}$$ "},{"data":["r","r"],"text":"$$\text{Upon further simplification, we get $\frac{(r ^2 q (r - 1))^3}{(rq (r - 1))^3}= r ^3$}$$"},{"data":["r","r"],"text":"$$\text{Putting the value of $k$ in RHS, we get $\frac{k }{q } = \frac{r ^3 q }{q } = r ^3$}$$"},{"data":["r","r"],"text":"$$\text{Putting the value of $k$, $l$, and $p$ in LHS we get $\sqrt{r ^3 q r ^2 q } + \sqrt{r ^2 q rq } - \sqrt{rq q }$}$$"},{"data":["r","r"],"text":"$$\text{Further simplification will get us the result $q \sqrt{ r } (r ^2 + r - 1)$}$$"},{"data":["r","r"],"text":"$$\text{Putting the value of $k$, $l$, and $p$ in the RHS we get $\sqrt{(r ^3 q + r ^2 q - rq ) (r ^2 q + rq - q )}$}$$"},{"data":["r","r"],"text":"$$\text{Further simplification will give us the result as $q \sqrt{r } (r ^2 + r - 1)$}$$"},{"data":[],"text":" "}];

sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
Suppose that \(k \), \(l \), \(p \), and \(q \) are in proportion. Now prove that, 
\[	
	\frac{(k - l )^3}{(l - p )^3} = \frac{k }{q } \text{ and, }
\]
\[
	\sqrt{kl } + \sqrt{lp } - \sqrt{pq } = \sqrt{(k + l - p )(l + p - q )}
\]
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "$$\text{
 
It is given that $k $, $l $, $p $, and $q $ are in proportion.}$$
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{k }{l } = \frac{l }{p } = \frac{p }{q } = r \textrm{ (assume)}
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow p = \input[s1v1]{}\input[s1v2]{}
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow l = rp = \input[s2v1]{} ^2 q 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow k = rl = r ^3 \input[s2v2]{}
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
Now, for the first equation, left hand side of the equation can be written as 
\[
	\textrm{LHS } = \frac{(k - l )^3}{(l - p )^3}
\]
\[
	= \frac{(\input[s3v1]{} ^3 q - r ^2 q )^3}{(r ^2 q - r\input[s3v2]{} )^3}
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	= \frac{(r ^2 q (\input[s4v1]{} - 1))^3}{(rq (r - 1))^3}
\]
\[
	= \input[s4v2]{} ^3
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
Right hand side of the equation can be written as
\[
	\frac{k }{q } = \frac{\input[s5v1]{} ^3 q }{q } = \input[s5v2]{} ^3 
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "$$\text{
From the above two expressions, we can write that LHS $=$ RHS.

Now, for the second equation, on left hand side we have}$$
\[
	\textrm{LHS } = \sqrt{kl } + \sqrt{lp } - \sqrt{pq }
\]
\[
	= \sqrt{\input[s6v1]{} ^3 q r ^2 q } + \sqrt{\input[s6v2]{} ^2 q rq } - \sqrt{rq q }
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	= q \sqrt{ \input[s7v1]{} } (\input[s7v2]{} ^2 + r - 1)
\]"}, {"id": "s8", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
Now, right hand side of the equation becomes
\[
	\textrm{RHS } = \sqrt{(k + l - p )(l + p - q )}
\]
\[
	= \sqrt{(\input[s8v1]{} ^3 q + r ^2 q - rq ) (\input[s8v2]{} ^2 q + rq - q )}
\]"}, {"id": "s9", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	= \sqrt{rq (\input[s9v1]{}^2 + r - 1) q (r ^2 + r - 1)}
\]
\[
	= q \sqrt{\input[s9v2]{} } (r ^2 + r - 1)
\]"}, {"id": "s10", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{
From the above two expressions, we can observe that LHS $=$ RHS.

Hence proved.
\newline
}$$
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["r", "q"], "text": "$$\text{After assumption $\frac{k }{l } = \frac{l }{p } = \frac{p }{q } = r$ and taking terms separately we get $p = rq$}$$ "}, {"data": ["r", "q"], "text": "$$\text{Similarly, for $l$ and $k$ we get $l = rp = r ^2 q$ and $k = rl = r ^3 q$}$$"}, {"data": ["r", "q"], "text": "$$\text{Substituting the value of $k$, $l$ and $p$ in the LHS, we get $\frac{(r ^3 q - r ^2 q )^3}{(r ^2 q - rq )^3}$}$$ "}, {"data": ["r", "r"], "text": "$$\text{Upon further simplification, we get $\frac{(r ^2 q (r - 1))^3}{(rq (r - 1))^3}= r ^3$}$$"}, {"data": ["r", "r"], "text": "$$\text{Putting the value of $k$ in RHS, we get $\frac{k }{q } = \frac{r ^3 q }{q } = r ^3$}$$"}, {"data": ["r", "r"], "text": "$$\text{Putting the value of $k$, $l$, and $p$ in LHS we get $\sqrt{r ^3 q r ^2 q } + \sqrt{r ^2 q rq } - \sqrt{rq q }$}$$"}, {"data": ["r", "r"], "text": "$$\text{Further simplification will get us the result $q \sqrt{ r } (r ^2 + r - 1)$}$$"}, {"data": ["r", "r"], "text": "$$\text{Putting the value of $k$, $l$, and $p$ in the RHS we get $\sqrt{(r ^3 q + r ^2 q - rq ) (r ^2 q + rq - q )}$}$$"}, {"data": ["r", "r"], "text": "$$\text{Further simplification will give us the result as $q \sqrt{r } (r ^2 + r - 1)$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
